title: Rate of change - at a point with concavity

content.prompt:
​

The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 2 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 3.5 comma negative 2.5).
  • The curve increases to cross the x axis at (negative 3.2 comma 0).
  • The curve continues to increase, gradually leveling off to a high point at (negative 2.3 comma 1.8).
  • The curve gradually decreases to its steepest point at about (negative 1.2 comma 1) then levels off at the origin, where it attains a low point.
  • The curve gradually increases to its steepest point at about (1.2 comma 1), then passes through the point (1.8 comma 1.6), labeled A, gradually leveling off at a high point at (2.3 comma 1.8).
  • The curve gradually decreases to cross the x axis at (3.2 comma 0).
  • The curve continues to decrease and exit the window at (3.5 comma negative 2.5).
  • The curve appears to be symmetric about the y axis.

​The graph of the function f and a point labeled A on the graph are shown. Which of the following statements about the graph of f at point A is true?

choices.label: ​At point A, the rate of change of f is negative, and the graph of f is concave down.
​​At point A, the rate of change of f is negative, and the graph of f is concave up.
​At point A, the rate of change of f is positive, and the graph of f is concave down.
​At point A, the rate of change of f is positive, and the graph of f is concave up.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
